jTdVdMry3lMt0oblROGW7A.text: There are very few restaurants in Singapore that can make a burger and fries so expertly. There's a great range of meats, so you're not stuck with beef. The vegetarian options are limited (2 burgers), but that wasn't surprising.The fries covered in gravy and cheese are utterly brilliant.Love the classic 70s diner ambiance, and the reasonably priced beer.

kAjokQ1yiusO2iuY_YCNbg.text: Burgers are OK, but quite pricey for what you get. Really uncomfortable set up, very loud and impossible to hear what your friends are saying. Really hard, uncomfortable benches as well. Not a place to linger.

DycdLLCaB7pgBAruH0qI-w.text: Contrary to the reviews here, my experience at Fat Boys was not a good one. Not sure if their standard has dropped over the years, since the other reviews are from a while back.We ordered the chocolate malt shake, and three burgers. The burgers were average while the fries were rather oily and soggy.Thumbs up for the atmosphere, but that's about it. A good place to chill with friends at night, but probably not worth the price and the GST and service charge. We spent around $20 per person

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

PdoAOPzWkH99KN7K_XFsPA.text: With no kids in tow for the night, we decided to venture to this joint with limited parking around. We started with a Corn Chips with Queso Chilli and damn it was goooood! Glad my hubby insisted on ordering it!He had the Bleu Cheese Peppercorn burger and I stole a bite. I would say it's more peppercorn than Bleu cheese taste there. Not a bad tasting burger at all. I had the Swiss Shroom Burger and it's good! Lots of oozing cheese and chunky mushrooms juicy patty! Had the vanilla milkshake and it's definitely made of good stuff! Very yummy!!!Definitely scratched our burger itch!! Will be back again when our itch acts up again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Bleu Cheese Peppercorn Burger
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Swiss Shroom Burger
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. Corn chips with Queso Chilli

ozyHx3q14zkfaGFHP_l09Q.text: The Fat Bastard was exceptional. I come from a major beef producing area in the USA and the beef at Fat Boys stood up very well to my well honed beef tastebuds.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore. The Fat Bastard

n0PGp3wKnTOpBtmea3bjwQ.text: One of the good things here is that you can build your own burger, it's always fun to have such liberty! They have a lot of options to choose even nutella or peanut butter as the burger sauce, quite unique! If you live in this area, this is a really great place to hang out casually compare to the overrated coffee joint next door. I like the ambiance, it's so chill, relaxing and unpretentious. The beef patty for my customized burger was not that great but did not disappoint, only hate the extremely thick buns. I had onion rings here too but I find it way too oily. However, milkshakes were great, I had the vanilla base with nutella. They also serve the best cider on earth from a UK brand in my favorite toffee apple flavor (not many places have this in Singapore btw). Overall, it's a great place to hang out with a mediocre food quality but great drinks nonetheless.

jl5LkjDWglpjUwQjdo4xyQ.text: Two words: THE BEST!Their flagship is called "Fat Basterd"; and as the name goes, it's one FAT burger, rich in patties and sauce. It's actually too big for my liking as I have difficulties finishing it so I normally go for the smaller version, which is named "Wimpy". Good thing is Wimpy comes in 3 choices of patty i.e. pork, beef or lamb.Their chips ain't great but the burgers more than make up for it. Best in this little red dot in my humble opinion.

v2Dww59sl11yzf1Bf7EdrQ.text: Loved the food; the onion rings and the Chilli they served with Nachos were outstanding, the bacon wrapped sausages & burgers themselves were pretty good!The music was a tad too loud & the beer was a tad less chilled but the ambience was buzzy and the service was friendly! Worth repeat visits

hnJXRjyEX3EkhTLO_dtv0A.text: Perhaps the best thing about Fatboy's is that they're serious about the burgers they offer. I found that out the first time I made a trip down to the outlet located in Upper Thomson. My fellow foodie Jeffrey had heard about it and was eager to give the burgers a try. While there are other offerings on the menu, we were very focused on our goal to test the burgers and subs out. What made it even more special was the opportunity to build our very own burger. Imagine a burger that has what you like. I was immediately sold on that and decided to build my own.The burgers were delivered and were instantly devoured by the both of us. Portions were huge and I can remember that I instantly made a mental note to come back should I have a burger craving. The sub we had was pretty decent, together with an assortment of appetizers. I would suggest sticking to the burgers as they do that very well. The subsequent visits we made were to try out their speciality burgers and guess what, they rock as well! But still nothing beats the burgers we customized ourselves!

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

m8aXTEG-_Q5w9sG_J0pkvw.text: Its been a while since I've been there but I still recall, very fondly, my last visit to Fatboy's.I remember ordering the Swiss Shroom Burger (becasue I'm a mushroom fanatic) and I enjoyed devouring the burger. Its just a lovely beef patty, gorgeous mushrooms and melted cheese with that awesome garlic aoli. Its simple yet heavenly.My friend ordered the Fat Basterd and he opened up the burger, seperated each level of the burger and very methodically ate each ingredient on its own. I guess Fatboy's gives people the opportunity to enjoy their food in a very innovative way. LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Fatboy's The Burger Bar - Singapore, Singapore

XOLVilPC2FA7NcFGqKJ2OA.text: What I like about Fatboy - unpretentious, comfort and delicious food at an affordable price. I have been here several times and tried a variety of their burgers - chicken and beef patty doused in various sauces  - and by far, I still love their beef patty the most. It's moist, soft, juicy and consistent. For the price you are paying, I say its a pretty fantastic burger and meal.

XcRqU_WXUePWtzdCHSRRMg.text: By far the best burger joint in Singapore. Even better than Omakase burger. The sweet potato fries were fantasitic., crispy on the outside but sweet and well mashed on the inside.

Nc9mp-TaO-Gz4z2HEPJulA.text: Good burgers and sides, definitely worth more visits.  Only issue I had was with the volume of their music, its too loud in an enclosed empty space of concrete, a common lack of volume control often ruins the dining experience.

LgNfJWHU-c8GxwuOZShsMQ.text: This is my second time visiting Fat Boys burger bar! My friend had a craving for burgers after our evening lecture, so we headed down to trusty Thomson road for some late night supper (TGIF!!)I tried the Elvis burger previously, very interesting combination of pork patty, banana and pb&j with fresh greens! I'll recommend this to anyone who wants to be slighty adventurous....Well I just wanted to go with a safe burger this time round so... HOLY CAESER ($12). It was goooood.... The chicken was done perfectly! I've eaten at The Handburger before and this was comparable! Huge serving of straight cut, chunky fries. I am usually pretty conscious about the food I put into myself, but the fries... Gosh addictive :)I'll be going back for more next week to celebrate my friends' birthdays!!

mOM_H0CmUgMxGhbvEMXHMQ.text: This burger bar is perfectly located on your way home if you live in the north. Traffic in upper thomson get's really bad during peak hours, so it's great to stop at this place, have a burger and leave again when the traffic cleared up. Parking space is not really abundant so be patient...The concept of this burger bar is too build your own burger, the true 'Have it your way" burger:CHOICE OF BUN: Sesame Seed Bun,Whole Meal Bun,Honey Oat BunCHOICE OF PATTY: Beef, Lamb, Pork, Grill Chicken, SalmonADD ONS: Bacon, Chili Queso, Guacamole, Portobello Mushroom, Sauteed Shitake Mushrooms, Sundried Tomatoes, Cheddar Cheese, Swiss Cheese, Monterey Jack, Cheese, Wild Arugula, Fried Egg, Beetroot, Caramelized Onions, Onion Marmalade, Grilled Bananas, Grilled Pineapple, Pickles, JalepenoSAUCES: Fatboy's Homemade BBQ, Wasabi Mayonnaise, Honey Mustard, Caesar Dressing, Roasted Garlic Aioli, Peanut Butter, Curry Remoulade, Bleu Cheese DressingSmoked Chipotle, Mango Chutney, NutellaThe lamb is juicy and has a lasting deep flavour and forms a perfect combination with the caramelized onions. This burger won't leave you hungry.

wpC94-VUG5WdMtJV8nE90Q.text: I had burgatory and ice tea. Spicy jalapeño sauce burger..loved the food and the ambience

xcbZjMBpDH4aSozkwj0z7w.text: Just alright, over priced for ok burgers and fries.
